function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Dependence on 5G for hosting network functions may increase the risk of spreading contagious diseases if the network is not adequately secured or maintained.","Impact":"Potential for uncontrolled spread of diseases due to network vulnerabilities.","Mitigation":"Implement robust security measures and regular maintenance of 5G network infrastructure to prevent unauthorized access and potential cyber attacks.","Technologies":"Secure network protocols and encryption, regular security audits, and software patch management for network infrastructure.","People":"Operators, network administrators, and cybersecurity experts responsible for maintaining the 5G network infrastructure.","Owner":"Network operators, technology companies, and regulatory authorities."},{"Description":"Imbalance in the supply chain for healthcare products such as PPE, ventilators, and drugs could lead to shortages, increasing the risk of healthcare workers and patients being exposed to contagious diseases.","Impact":"Increased vulnerability of healthcare workers and patients to contagious diseases due to inadequate supply of essential protective equipment and medical devices.","Mitigation":"Implement effective supply chain management strategies, diversify suppliers, maintain emergency stockpiles, and establish rapid response protocols for surges in demand.","Technologies":"Supply chain management software, real-time tracking systems, predictive analytics for demand forecasting, and emergency inventory management systems.","People":"Healthcare supply chain managers, procurement officers, and healthcare administrators.","Owner":"Healthcare organizations, government agencies, and regulatory bodies."}]}
